definitions.definition: a part that is added to something to enlarge or prolong it; a continuation.
synonyms: bump-out "they are planning a new extension"

definitions.definition: a room or set of rooms added to an existing building.
examples: addition, adjunct, annex, wing, supplementary building, ell, add-on, bump-out they are planning a new extension

definitions.definition: the action or process of becoming or making something larger.
examples: the extension of the president's powers

definitions.definition: an application of an existing system or activity to a new area.
examples: direct marketing is an extension of telephone selling

definitions.definition: an increase in the length of time given to someone to hold office, complete a project, or fulfill an obligation.
examples: prolongation, lengthening, increase More"an extension of opening hours"postponement, more/extra time, deferral, delay "I need an extension on my essay"Morean extension of opening hourspostponement, more/extra time, deferral, delay I need an extension on my essay

definitions.definition: an optional suffix to a file name, typically consisting of a period followed by several characters, indicating the file's content or function.
a length of electric cord that permits the use of an appliance at some distance from a fixed socket.
an extra telephone on the same line as the main one.
a subsidiary telephone in a set of offices or similar building, on a line leading from the main switchboard but having its own additional number.
instruction by a university or college for students who do not attend full time.
lengths of real or artificial hair woven into a person's own hair to create a long hairstyle.
the action of moving a limb from a bent to a straight position.
examples: seizures with sudden rigid extension of the limbs

definitions.definition: the ability of a dancer to raise one leg above the waist, or an instance of this.
the application of traction to a fractured or dislocated limb or to an injured or diseased spinal column to restore it to its normal position.
the lengthening of a horse's stride within a particular gait.
the range of a term or concept as measured by the objects that it denotes or contains, as opposed to its internal content.
the property of occupying space; spatial magnitude.
examples: nature, for Descartes, was pure extension in space
